We stayed there with my boyfriend for 2 nights.The design of the rooms are modern and for the people who dont like kitsch and old fashioned hotels.A little boutique hotel with all in one.There is a little kitchen with cooking equipment and almost everything you may need in bathroom.The staff is helpful and warm.They serve the most delicious breakfast ever as well.You can eat French toast with cinnamon and raisins,pancakes or the regular breakfast plate with newly baked tasty breads.-though their plate is too big for a "regular" one.- Next time i will definetely choose this hotel to stay again.

A good boutique hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Ansen Suites in March of 2006. We were impressed by the place and had a great stay there. (We negotiate a pretty decent rate too so don’t settle for the list price unless you’re in peak season.)

First off Istanbul is a dirty, polluted place. The food is plain (and mostly bad) and you’d get a better kebab in Islington than even the best rated ocakbasi we went to (Timeout and HG2 recommended). The people you are most likely to meet are dodgy ‘wheeler dealer’ sorts (although not threatening) and you have a good chance of being palmed off with counterfeit notes! I have always wanted to go to Istanbul but frankly places like Rome, Madrid, Venice, Prague etc. had somewhat more appeal for me personally. I can say that whilst I wouldn’t rush back, it is worth braving the negatives for – that is if you have an interest in the history and want a break with more to it than caffeine laced art galleries.
reviews.title: Serene oasis with great space, food and service

reviews.text: The Ansen Suites is a good boutique hotel for the money, by any city’s standards. We stayed in 2 rooms, being upgraded on our last night to the penthouse. Both were facing the ancient city, looking out over the ‘Golden Horn’ (the channel of water dividing the European side of the city) to the Blue Mosque which made for great views. The Penthouse was identical to the first room we had except it had uninterrupted panoramic views and a small terrace. In all other respects the rooms were identical. Décor – modern and stylish; facilities – broadband, satellite, hotel bar etc; bathroom – shower (no baths) but very modern and with designer soaps etc.. The staff were friendly and helpful (and even (genuinely!) invited us to a very lively private party they had one night). Situation is pretty good, near the main shopping street and close by to quite a few of the best rated restaurants (although as I mention good food is hard to come by in Istanbul). It's a short (<5min) and hairy taxi ride from the blue mosque and the main sites. If you want to brave the pollution, dodgy dealers and pitiful tucker of Istanbul definitely stay here!
reviews.title: Great Location, nice hotel

reviews.text: The Ansen Suites is a small residence that offers modern studio apartments, complete with everything you need for a comfortable stay. It's more homey and more spacious than just a room with a bed for the same price. It is superbly located in the middle of Istanbul's trendy Pera district (if you want some nightlife), with good transportation links. The room is exactly as you see in the photos. It was very quiet, nicely decorated in neutral colors and had a very calm feeling. The king-size bed was firm, but not hard, and the linens were excellent. The bathroom was spacious, with amenities, bathrobes, and luxurious towels. A very wide person could have a problem in the stand-up shower compartment. Water pressure was strong. The kitchenette was equipped for two people and had a fully stocked mini-bar/refrigerator and a dishwasher. The free WiFi had a strong signal. The included breakfast downstairs was a real sit-down breakfast: omelettes, cold platter, bread, coffee, juice. The owner was charming and gracious and the small staff friendly and extremely attentive. They all couldn't have been better. The restaurant downstairs is excellent. There is a small Dia supermarket about a half block away. The only minor negatives I can think of are that there are no blackout curtains (it still gets dark enough), that the rooms tend to be a little underlit, and that the door could have a more substantial lock (not a big concern). I would absolutely choose Ansen Suites for my next stay in Istanbul and I will recommend it to my friends. I wish I'd known about it the last time.
reviews.title: Exactly like it looks - modern, very comfortable, great location

reviews.title: Pretty good but needs a little help plus minor scam

reviews.text: This is a nice small boutique hotel with an expensive restaurant. The staff is friendly enough and their English is pretty good. The room was clean and the service was marginal, they forgot to replenish toiletries and kitchenette supplies. Internet connectivity was free but a little spotty, especially at night. The location is not all that bad across the Golden Horn near the Galata Tower. A problem did come up when I went to pay my bill. Because I had already had a few scam issues come up in Istanbul I was a little gun shy, I was kind of worried about the bill. I booked for a room at one rate for three nights which meant I would get a 10% discount, as clearly advertised on the web site and through e-mail correspondence. When I arrived I was upgraded to a better quality room because the room I booked was not available but it was clear I would pay the same price as my original room rate. It was great to get a better room with a better view for my original rate. It seemed like it was a forced upgrade, but in any event it was nice to get the upgrade. When I went to pay my bill I was told that the 10% discount only applied if I was paying in cash. I know this scam because it had already been tried on me twice in restaurants, i.e., can’t take your credit card because the purchase price is to small (actually the game/scam is to act like your credit card doesn’t work on those neat little ‘at your table’ credit card processing scanners). The gentlemen at Ansen kept telling me that I got such a great deal with my upgrade that the full price was really fair, which didn’t have anything to do with paying cash. After going around and around for a while Ansen 130 Suites won out and I paid the full price with a credit card and no discount. Another Istanbul lesson learned. Count on some sort of scam for just about everything. To protect a little from this I would suggest that you totally, totally try to get clear on all Istanbul transactions before the bill arrives (before you commit to the purchase). I should have done this at the Ansen.
reviews.title: Wonderful, friendly hotel in a great area of Istanbul
Good, but in some ways style over substance.
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend Ansen Suites 130. There were eight of us travelling together and our rooms were large and stylish, although the lighting could definitely be improved. Everything was very clean (except for the carpet in the lift!) and the service was exceptional. Orhan, the manager, said that he likes the hotel to feel like home. We felt genuinely cared for throughout our stay. Breakfast was large and pretty good and the Italian restaurant was also good. They were very happy to make reservations at other restaurants for us - and there is certainly no shortage of restaurants in Istanbul! Everyone seems to eat out all the time. Every night felt like Saturday night. The hotel is located in a good area, not too noisy at night, but close enough to shops, restaurants and the beautiful Bosphorus. There is a lovely lounge at the back of the hotel, which was perfect for our group of eight, once we managed to work out how to turn the music down. We will certainly go back to Ansen Suites if we return to Istanbul.

The hotel is small and cozy and everyone made us feel like family. We had a problem with a car and although it was early Mehmet made sure that we got a taxi and got to our destiation on time can't say enough about the staff or the comfortable room.

reviews.text: A great place to stay in Istanbul, away from the impersonal hotel boxes. The staff are hospitable and helpful. The rooms are like studios. I stayed in the penthouse and it was really great. The whole place is spotless. Its location is ideal, as you can wonder around in Pera and then use the public transportation system or a taxi to go where you want. The building is in the historic area of Pera (Beyoglou) with beautiful architecture all over. Although there are a lot of tourists around, this is an area inhabited by the people leaving in Istanbul. It is safe, clean, and very nice if you like city space.
